Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mannerchor \M["a]n"ner*chor`\, n.; G. pl. {-ch["o]re}. [G.; m["a]nner, pl. of mann man + chor chorus.] A German men's chorus or singing club. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chore \Chore\ (ch[=o]r), n. [The same word as char work done by the day.] A small job; in the pl., the regular or daily light work of a household or farm, either within or without doors. [U. S.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chore \Chore\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Chored}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Choring}.] To do chores. [U. S.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chore \Chore\, n. A choir or chorus. [Obs.] --B. Jonson. [1913 Webster] ||

chore n : a specific piece of work required to be done as a duty or for a specific fee; "estimates of the city's loss on that job ranged as high as a million dollars"; "the job of repairing the engine took several hours"; "the endless task of classifying the samples"; "the farmer's morning chores" [syn: {job}, {task}]
